_comment1: The, base structure class to use for the behavior of the structure. In this case, minecraft:jigsaw is good for most structures.
_comment2: the, path to the template pool json file to use
_comment3: This, is how many pieces away from the starting piece a piece of the structure can spawn
_comment4: Think, of it like the length of the branch of the structure
_comment5: Maximum, distance away from center that pieces can spawn. Cannot be greater than 128
_comment6: The biome tag to use for what biomes that this structure can spawn in
_comment7: The, generation step for when to generate the structure. there are 10 stages you can pick from!
_comment8: This, surface structure stage places the structure before plants and ores are generated
_comment9: See, GenerationStep.Feature enum for all the stages you can use and what order they are in
_comment10: This, will add land around the bottom of the structure. (Based on the starting piece's y value)
_comment11: The, kinds of values allowed here are: none, beard_thin, beard_box, and bury
_comment12: If, no land change is deseried, removed this field entirely.
_comment13: Where to spawn our structure at what y value if project_start_to_heightmap is not present.
_comment14: start_height can be used to spawn at a random fixed y value by doing something like:
_comment15: If project_start_to_heightmap is present, the y value chosen in start_height will be added to the terrain's y value.
_comment16: So a start height that gives -5 will sink the structure 5 blocks into the terrain.
_comment17: Makes our house snap to top land to spawn at. WORLD_SURFACE_WG will stop at first non-air block.
_comment18: To get top land at even the bottom of oceans, use OCEAN_FLOOR_WG.
_comment19: If no projection desired, remove this field entirely.
_comment20: Keep, this false. This is only for vanilla legacy villages to make it spawn properly. We don't need no hacks here!
_comment21: Optional thing to control whether the structure will be waterlogged when replacing pre-existing water in the world.
_comment22: Set this to 'ignore_waterlogging' if you are making underground structures that you do not want to get waterlogged and flooded by aquifiers.
_comment23: What mobs can spawn over time in the structure.
_comment24: Make sure you add the mob to the right category (monster, creature, etc)

monster._comment25: Use the bounding box of entire structure instead of individual pieces.

_comment26: Optional thing that allows swapping a template pool with another per structure json instance. More of an expert niche thing.
